title: Remembrance Day services mark 107 years since the end of WWI | ABC NEWS
description: The nation has paused to mark Remembrance Day and honour the more than 100,000 Australians who lost their lives in conflict. It marks 107 years since the end of World War I. The national service at the Australian War Memorial in Canberra looked to the future with a warning against complacency during a time of peace. title: Delhi blast: Indian police invoke anti-terror law, PM Modi alleges conspiracy | The World | ABC News
description: Indian police are investigating a deadly car blast in New Delhi under a law used to fight "terrorism". Prime Minister Narendra Modi has vowed to bring to justice all those responsible. The explosion near the historic Red Fort killed at least eight people and injured 20. It was the first such blast in the heavily guarded city of more than 30 million since 2011. Deputy editor at The Hindu, Vijaita Singh spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the latest on the investigation. title: Thailand suspends peace agreement with Cambodia | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Thailand says it will suspend its peace deal with Cambodia after Thai soldiers were injured in a landmine blast along the border. title: United Nations Climate Change Conference COP30 underway in Brazil | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The United Nation's COP30 conference has officially kicked off in the Brazilian city of Belem. Inside the summit, world leaders and indigenous communities will spend the next eleven days working through a climate agenda. Outside, activists are making demands of their own. Amanda Robson reports.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Did the BBC mislead viewers about Trump? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: We want to hear from you! Please complete our survey: 2025 ABC News Daily Audience Survey (https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=mkDBl3hw50e7lNHlNQPgEpOxE0YscZ5Au4rK0pnU0zpURUxPU0ZaM0g0M1NaSEg4QVFVUFFKMVc4Uy4u)    Donald Trump wants to sue a media organisation - again.    This time he’s threatening a US $1 billion lawsuit against the BBC, capping off one of the worst weeks in the British public broadcaster’s history.   Both the corporation’s director-general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness have resigned following criticism over the editing of a January 6th speech by US President Donald Trump.   Today, Monica Attard, professor of journalism at the University of Technology Sydney and former ABC journalist, on what’s unfolded and attacks on public broadcasters.    Featured:    Monica Attard, professor of journalism at the University of Technology Sydney and former ABC journalist

title: Chinese 'cryptoqueen' jailed in UK over $9bn Bitcoin laundering scheme | ABC NEWS
description: Chinese woman Zhiman Qian has been jailed for 11 years over a AUD$9 billion Bitcoin laundering scheme. British authorities say the woman dubbed the ‘cryptocurrency queen’ was the mastermind behind a scheme into which around 128,000 victims in China invested billions of dollars. title: India, Pakistan rocked by deadly blasts hours apart | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities in India and Pakistan are investigating two bomb blasts that occurred hours apart in their respective capitals.  In Islamabad, a suicide bomber detonated a car bomb outside a courthouse, killing at least 12 and injuring over 20. The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility, while Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif suggested an India-backed extremist group was involved – a claim India denies. In New Delhi, a vehicle explosion on Monday evening killed at least eight people and is being considered a possible terrorist attack. title: Russia loses battle over Canberra embassy, but is granted compensation | ABC NEWS
description: Russia has lost its legal battle over the site of its planned embassy in Canberra, but the Australian government must compensate it for revoking the lease. The government terminated the lease in 2023, citing national security concerns flagged by ASIO. title: Victoria's 'Adult Time for Violent Crime' policy for children 14 and over | ABC NEWS
description: Children aged 14 and above who commit violent crimes in Victoria will face adult sentences under Victorian government reforms. A bill called 'Adult Time for Violent Crime' will be drafted and brought to state parliament this year.  It will significantly increase the likelihood of a prison sentence for offenders of certain crimes such as aggravated home invasion, carjacking, and armed robbery. The changes will also increase the maximum length of sentences for child offenders. title: St Vincent Hospital’s triage program aims to close the gap in First Nations care | ABC NEWS
description: A triage program at St Vincent’s Hospital Melbourne aims to assess and begin treatment for First Nations people within half an hour of their arrival. Dr Jonty Karro says the program has eliminated the gap between First Nations and non-Indigenous patients on their waiting time to be seen by a clinician.
